question:
In context with the recent news coverage of Eswatini, consider the following statements:
  1. It is in West Africa.
  2. It is an absolute monarchy.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Eswatini, previously known as Swaziland, is a country in the South African region. It is a landlocked country and shares land boundary with South Africa and Mozambique. It is one of the smallest countries in the continent. It has two capitals: Mbabane (executive capital) and Lobamba (legislative capital). Statement 2 is correct: Eswatini or the Kingdom of Eswatini is one of the last few absolute monarchies in the world. Its ruler is King Mswati III who has been in power since 1986. The country was in news in context with the recent arrest of pro- democracy protestors.
